snippet: Disasters cost the state $36 million, a lot less than the $150 million that Gov. Jay Nixon set aside. Legislative budget leaders said that the money was an unnecessary budget manipulation.
abstract: Final bill for Missouri's 2011 disasters, like Joplin tornado and widespread flooding, cost state $36 million, much less than $150 million that Gov Jay Nixon set aside; legislative budget leaders say the money was an unnecessary budget manipulation.
lead_paragraph: Disasters cost the state $36 million, a lot less than the $150 million that Gov. Jay Nixon set aside. Legislative budget leaders said that the money was an unnecessary budget manipulation.

headline.main: Missouri Set Aside Too Much to Cover Cost of Disasters in 2011
headline.print_headline: Missouri: State Set Aside Too Much To Cover Cost of Disasters In 2011
